alert.note: Alert for Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 22 at 2:47PM PDT until October 23 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM PDT SUNDAY ABOVE 5000 FEET... * WHAT...Wet snow above 5000 feet expected. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 5 inches. Winds gusting as high as 30 mph. * WHERE...Portions of the Southern Oregon Cascades north of Highway 140. This includes portions of Highway 62 including Crater Lake, portions of Highway 138 near and including Diamond Lake, and portions of Highway 58 near Willamette Pass. * WHEN...Until 5 AM PDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Amounts may be a little less due to some melting, especially on roadways during the day, but accumulations are still possible above 5000 feet as road surfaces cool with additional snow and colder temperatures. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades
